<a href="https://www.wsj.com/news/noted?mod=wsj_noted_MB_sectionfront_june20" style="border-bottom:none!important;" target="_blank"></a>
</th>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top:20px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good evening</strong> (very weird to write)<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>and welcome to a special edition Brew recapping the first half of 2020. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Think back to January 1. You were shaking hands with everyone you met. The words “social distancing” made absolutely no sense. And getting tested meant something...very different. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But humans adapt, and the fact that we’re still here reading email like chumps shows our resilience. We hope this newsletter allows you to take a step back, put all the events of H1 in context, and go into the second half of the year with more energy and purpose. </p>
<p class="p1" style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Before we dive in...</strong>we want to offer a huge thank you to all the frontline and essential workers who made the world turn in H1, from doctors and nurses to store clerks and municipal workers. Your perseverance will not be forgotten.</p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if !mso ]><! -- -->
</div>
<!-- <![endif]-->


<!--[if !mso ]><! -- -->
<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/28/reflecting-h1s-historic-economic-shutdown?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Great Pause: We Can Do That?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Coronavirus" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82NzIvY29yb25hdmlydXMucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What will the first half of 2020 be remembered for? Likely when a microscopic parasite much, much smaller than bacteria—SARS-CoV-2—demanded that we slam the brakes on the global economy to prevent mass death. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So we did. Countries around the globe performed the first coordinated global shutdown of the economy...ever. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Restaurants, retail stores, and offices were shuttered. Bustling airports turned into ghost towns. With theaters closed, performers were forced to give concerts on balconies. <a href="https://twitter.com/WorldwideFP/status/1238850458011275264?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Some</a> were better than <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VCyB15M6Jzw&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">others</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Not to get all 1am in the dorm room on you, but it's worth pausing to consider just how un...paralleled that is. Starting with…</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The fallout</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You already know this part. We're in the worst economic crisis since the Great Depression. 93% of the world's workforce lives in countries with partial or full workplace closures, the UN said in April. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In Q2, the world lost the equivalent of 400 million full-time jobs due to a decline in working hours from the COVID-19 crisis, the UN's labor arm </span><span><a href="https://www.ilo.org/global/about-the-ilo/newsroom/news/WCMS_749398/lang--en/index.htm?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reported</a></span><span>. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">As for the macro stats...</strong>last week, the IMF projected the global economy will <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/24/business/imf-world-economic-outlook.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shrink</a> by 4.9% this year, worse than earlier projections. It called this "a crisis like no other."</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNTIxL2ltZi5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24ifQ==" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="" data-reactroot=""><sup style="display: inline-block; line-height: 16px;"><small><em>IMF</em> </small></sup> </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">How we're getting through it </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">No. 1: </strong>A historic tsunami of government intervention.<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>In the U.S., Congress has <a href="https://www.npr.org/2020/05/15/854774681/congress-has-approved-3-trillion-for-coronavirus-relief-so-far-heres-a-breakdown?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">authorized</a> a record-shattering $3 trillion for coronavirus relief—and it may not be done yet. The Fed, meanwhile, has done everything it can to encourage spending, borrowing, and investing short of secretly installing Robinhood apps on our phones like it's a U2 album. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">No. 2: </strong>Advanced communications and information tech allowed many workplaces to shift to remote in surprisingly seamless fashion. Sophisticated delivery systems enabled by the smartphone brought the grocery store, local restaurants, and bookstores to our doorsteps. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Retailers</span><span><strong style="color:#000"> </strong></span><span>also </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/amazon-to-keep-most-of-the-jobs-it-added-during-pandemic-11590661802?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">adjusted</a></span><span> logistics systems to keep the drop-offs coming. Amazon added 125,000 permanent jobs during the pandemic, while Walmart hired more than 235,000 temporary workers.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the focus has shifted from the shutdown to the best way to un-shut-down. That's going to be <a href="https://www.politico.com/news/magazine/2020/06/16/coronavirus-shutdown-kill-switch-320497?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">much more</a> complicated. </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RACISM
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/30/corporate-america-finally-says-black-lives-matter?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Corporate America Joins the Fight
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Don't do it ad" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMTc3L2Rvbl90X2RvX2l0X2FkLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Nike</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This spring, killings of three unarmed Black Americans led to the most widespread protests over racial injustice and police brutality in decades. And this time, a new face joined the action: corporate America.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Businesses said the three words they’ve skirted for years: Black Lives Matter. And they promised, <em>this time</em>, things would change.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Some broke open their wallets.</strong> Bank of America <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-minneapolis-police-bank-of-america/bank-of-america-pledges-1-billion-to-address-racial-economic-inequality-idUSKBN2391NO?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pledged</a> $1 billion over four years to address inequality. PayPal set up a $530 million fund to support minority-owned businesses. Pepsi’s $400+ million initiative includes doubling its spend with Black-owned suppliers. And Walmart, Comcast, Sony, Apple, Netflix, and SoftBank committed $100 million apiece to various initiatives. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Others looked twice at what they’re selling. </strong>Quaker Oats and Mars are <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/17/aunt-jemima-uncle-bens-owners-rethink-offensive-brands?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">removing</a> racist branding and imagery from Aunt Jemima and Uncle Ben’s food lines, respectively. Beauty giants Unilever and L’Oréal will remove “fair” and “whitening” labels from skin lightening products. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In tech, Amazon and Microsoft said they'd </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2020/06/12/microsoft-amazon-announce-restrictions-facial-recognition-sales-police-departments.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pause</a></span><span> selling facial recognition software, which has been criticized for showing racial bias, to police departments. IBM shut down its facial recognition unit completely.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In retail, chains including Sephora and Rent the Runway signed the 15 Percent Pledge to devote more shelf space to products from Black-owned businesses. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>those are powerful commitments from some of the private sector’s most influential brands. But their legacy in confronting racial injustice will be determined by their actions when the world <em>isn't</em> watching. </p>

<tr>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
STATS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/28/h1-numbers?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
H1 By the Numbers
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Marketwatch" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNTMxL2pvYmxlc3NfY2xhaW1zLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/another-138-million-new-jobless-claims-predicted-why-arent-they-falling-faster-2020-06-24" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">MarketWatch</a> | Before COVID-19, the all-time record for weekly jobless claims never cracked 700,000. This April, claims neared 7 million in a single week.</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A look at the other numbers that have defined the last six months of COVID, quarantine, and craziness. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Coronavirus</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">10.4 million </strong></span><span><a href="https://coronavirus.jhu.edu/map.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cases</a></span><span> worldwide</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">2.7 million</strong></span><span> cases in the U.S. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Black Lives Matter</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">4,000+ </strong></span><span>cities and towns worldwide have had </span><span><a href="https://www.creosotemaps.com/blm2020/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">some form of public protest</a></span><span> in the name of racial justice since May 25</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Five</strong></span><span> Black CEOs </span><span><a href="https://fortune.com/2020/06/01/black-ceos-fortune-500-2020-african-american-business-leaders/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lead Fortune 500</a></span><span> companies, none of whom are women </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Travel</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">96% </strong></span><span>decrease in travelers </span><span><a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/air-traffic-during-coronavirus-pandemic-changes-effects-around-the-world-2020-4#what-the-continuation-of-commercial-flights-in-the-us-masks-is-just-how-few-people-are-flying-on-them-7?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">passing through U.S. airport security</a></span><span> from March 1 to April 16</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">37% </strong></span><span>expected </span><span><a href="https://str.com/press-release/us-hotel-demand-not-expected-fully-recover-until-2023?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">drop in U.S. hotel occupancy</a></span><span> in 2020 year over year, per STR</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Entertainment</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">6.1 billion</strong></span><span> hours of </span><span><a href="https://www.pcmag.com/news/us-netflix-subscribers-watch-32-hours-and-use-96-gb-of-data-per-day?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Netflix watched</a></span><span> by U.S. viewers in April</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">$300,000</strong></span><span> </span><span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/film/2020/mar/20/us-box-office-drops-97-year-on-year-on-wednesday-to-reach-historic-low?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">total U.S. box office revenues</a></span><span> on March 18, 2020, down from $11 million on the same date in 2019</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Work</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Half</strong></span><span> of all Americans employed before the coronavirus pandemic are now </span><span><a href="https://www.brynjolfsson.com/remotework/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">working remotely</a></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">30x</strong></span><span> growth in the </span><span><a href="https://cloudwars.co/covid-19/zoom-quarter-10-eye-popping-stats-from-techs-new-superstar/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">number of daily participants</a></span><span> who use Zoom (10 million in December 2019 to 300 million in April)</span>
</li>
</ul>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY THE WALL STREET JOURNAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
A First Look at WSJ Noted
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.wsj.com/news/noted?mod=wsj_noted_MB_sectionfront_june20" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="The Wall Street Journal" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=335 src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/6/q/5ef5f7d05abac.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="The Wall Street Journal" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/6/q/5ef5f7d05abac.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>WSJ Noted.</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>Education, culture, work, money, health, politics.</div>
<div> </div>
<div>So much has changed in so little time, especially for young adults. Because of that, The Wall Street Journal has created a new digital publication, <a href="https://www.wsj.com/news/noted?mod=wsj_noted_MB_sectionfront_june20" target="_blank" class="link" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=http://wsj.com/news/noted?mod%3Dwsj_noted_MB_sectionfront_june20&source=gmail&ust=1593210888587000&usg=AFQjCNEVYUgTaQh3RG7qLjeDfaLGKQhijA" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">WSJ Noted</a>, to cover issues facing this new generation.</div>
<div> </div>
<div>From reporting on higher education to health—plus recommendations on what to watch, listen to, and read—WSJ Noted will amplify the experiences of young adults, while upholding the Journal’s foundation of trustworthy journalism.</div>
<div>
<br>Get to know the journalists behind <a href="http://bit.ly/notedIG" target="_blank" class="link" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=http://bit.ly/notedIG&source=gmail&ust=1593210888587000&usg=AFQjCNFYJPja1483GU7x0KP0B0aVqUqjdA" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">WSJ Noted on Instagram</a> and <a href="https://www.wsj.com/news/noted?mod=wsj_noted_MB_sectionfront_june20" target="_blank" class="link" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=http://wsj.com/news/noted?mod%3Dwsj_noted_MB_sectionfront_june20&source=gmail&ust=1593210888587000&usg=AFQjCNEVYUgTaQh3RG7qLjeDfaLGKQhijA" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">read the first issue here</a>.</div>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/28/tale-three-crises-twitter-fared-h1?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Jack Dorsey Would Like a Vacation
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you know a business that hasn't been profoundly transformed in H1, reply with the name because we didn't know there were companies on Mars. 2020 has presented crisis after crisis for corporate America, and we can't think of a better case study than Twitter.  </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">COVID-19</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In an oddly prescient moment in February, CEO Jack Dorsey told investors Twitter would move to a <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/02/08/twitter-ceo-jack-dorsey-san-francisco-comments-a-warning-sign.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more distributed workforce</a>. After the pandemic reached the West Coast, it was among the first to let staff WFH; by March 11, WFH was mandatory. By May, it was a permanent option.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Dorsey also personally pledged $1 billion (~25% of his wealth) to COVID-19 relief and other causes, the biggest individual contribution by far.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Protests</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As demonstrations against racial injustice spread, Twitter was one of, if not the, <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/10/opinion/sunday/twitter-protest-politics.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">most important</a> platforms for protestors to share information and organize. And a few weeks ago, Twitter led big businesses in making Juneteenth a corporate holiday. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Misinformation</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">May 26, 2020, may go down as one of the most important dates in Twitter history after a pair of Trump tweets about mail-in voting finally <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/05/30/technology/twitter-trump-dorsey.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">set off</a> the tripwire: Twitter <a href="https://apnews.com/700c52aab0869253625b80255a397f19?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">labeled</a> them as "potentially misleading," and a few days later labeled another Trump tweet as "glorifying violence." </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Heading into the election, President Trump and all of social media are twisted up in their thorniest tussle over content moderation to date.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>In February, activist investors reportedly tried to <a href="https://www.usatoday.com/story/tech/2020/02/28/twitter-ceo-jack-dorsey-elliott-management/4910121002/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">oust</a> Dorsey. Today, he's set aside the ice baths and meditation retreats to steer Twitter through a trio of crises. </p>

<tr>

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86576e04837.jpg">

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e8657887c532.jpg">
</a>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
OTHER NEWS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/28/underreported-business-stories-2020?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Don't Worry, We Didn't Forget You
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Siblings" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=312 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/TwogfoUd8M6eA/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Siblings" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/TwogfoUd8M6eA/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The 2020 news cycle has been dominated by a pair of storylines, and—with Luke Hemsworth as proof—we don't always notice the third thing when two take up our attention. Here are some important biz stories that flew under the radar this year...</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big tech: </strong>The FTC expanded its investigations into the largest tech companies over <a href="https://www.axios.com/tech-summer-antitrust-24cffcc6-8afc-41f8-9b91-5be6d8269202.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">anticompetition concerns</a>. The Justice Department, House Judiciary Committee, and state attorneys general have all launched antitrust probes that will heat up this summer, virus or not.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Samsung scandal: </strong>The South Korean conglomerate is <a href="https://www.economist.com/business/2020/06/20/no-end-in-sight-for-samsungs-legal-troubles?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">still wading through</a> a swamp of legal troubles surrounding its founding family. De facto leader Lee Jae-yong is currently awaiting trial for manipulating merger terms, among other allegations. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Gig workers: </strong>Food delivery services were hit with lawsuits as DoorDash and others <a href="https://www.foodandwine.com/news/san-francisco-district-attorney-sues-doordash?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">continued to classify</a> workers as independent contractors rather than employees, defying California's new AB 5 law.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Trade: </strong>As the COVID-19 blame game soured relations between China and the U.S., suspicions arose that the countries' Phase 1 trade deal, signed in January, would collapse. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>White House trade advisor Peter Navarro </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/23/business/economy/trump-navarro-china-trade-deal.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">walked back</a></span><span> his recent statement that the deal was over, and President Trump said it remains "fully intact." </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Space travel:</strong> We doubt you missed the news that a private company (SpaceX) flew humans into space for the first time in May. Elon Musk is now <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/31/spacex-successfully-launches-humans-space?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">one step closer</a> to raising X Æ A-12 on Mars.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F06%2F28%2Funderreported-business-stories-2020" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=All+the+important+headlines+that+were+hiding+in+COVID-19%27s+shadow&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/28/underreported-business-stories-2020&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;">New York City painted white circles on the grass of Domino Park in Brooklyn to promote social distancing. </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRENDS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/28/things-sped-covid19?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
These Needed the Bump of a Pandemic
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It sometimes feels like the world stopped spinning in 2020. Well, most of the time. But the pandemic also took some trends that were just getting a foothold and shot them into overdrive.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Remote work: </strong>When lockdowns started in March, businesses had only days to spin up the infrastructure to support a remote workforce. Now that offices are slowly reopening, a growing cohort of workers may never endure a daily commute again as employers <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/29/remote-work-destiny?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">embrace WFH</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Higher ed:</strong> <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/15/higher-ed-will-never?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Colleges</a> are built around cramming youths into dorms and stuffing their minds with knowledge in lecture halls. That model may not work for the upcoming academic year, and colleges are racing to prepare virtual-first learning experiences. Major changes in the admissions process are also underway as universities finally throw out standardized test requirements. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Virtual spaces: </strong>People are finding new ways to socialize, and gaming platforms provide, quite literally, <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/08/virtual-worlds-stay?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new worlds</a> for hanging out and entertainment. While the Staples Center can hold 20,000...<em>Fortnite</em> can hold a lot more. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Cities:</strong> Urban areas need to <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/24/future-cities?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rethink and redesign</a> with public health in mind. Many were starting to dabble in smart city tech, and now they'll have extra ammunition to make big investments in sensors, automation, and other tech that can help improve safety and health.   </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Retail:</strong> Online shopping was trending up before the pandemic, but now its prospects are looking brighter than ever—in the U.S., e-commerce sales <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2020/05/12/us-e-commerce-sales-jump-49-in-april-led-by-online-grocery/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">increased</a> 49% in April. The hottest category is <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/19/covid-consumer?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">online grocery shopping</a>, which has made years' worth of inroads in a few months. March sales were 200% higher than last year.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CALENDAR
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/30/2020-second-half-preview?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
But Wait, There's More...
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We've done enough looking back—it's time to look ahead. Here’s a glimpse into what the next sixth months hold. Disclaimer: Like everything this year, these events are subject to change. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">July</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Since everything’s gone downhill on Earth, maybe it’s time to explore other options. NASA will launch the Mars Perseverance Rover on July 22. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The shortened MLB season starts July 23, and the NBA season will resume July 30. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>BTS’s ARMY will take over the internet again when the K-pop sensations release their Japanese album July 14.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">August</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Prepare to dive back into the world of sparkly vampires with Stephenie Meyer’s </span><span><em>Twilight</em></span><span> prequel on Aug. 4. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In case you forgot, there’s a presidential election going on: the DNC starts Aug. 17, the RNC on Aug. 24. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Organized following the outrage over George Floyd’s death, the “Get Off Our Necks” March on Washington will take place Aug. 28. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">September–October</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>We spent the spring entirely without sports, but they are coming back with a vengeance in the fall. The Kentucky Derby will take place on Sept. 5, followed by the NFL kickoff on the 10th. The U.S. Open in tennis will conclude the 13th. The Ryder Cup closes out the month, starting Sept. 25. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>On TV, look out for the Emmys on September 20 and tune in for the first presidential debate on Sept. 29. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Too many people will dress up as Joe Exotic for Halloween. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">November–December</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Prepare for a hectic start to November. Election Day is Nov. 3 and the U.S. officially leaves the Paris climate accord Nov. 4. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>One thing the end of the year certainly won’t be missing provided we make it this far: sufficient amounts of golf. The Masters starts Nov. 9. And at some point, the 2020–2021 NHL and NBA seasons will start. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Zoom out for a global perspective: The G20 is scheduled for Nov. 21–22 in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia. This year’s Nobel Prizes will be awarded on Dec. 10. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>We expect Thanksgiving to be extra meaningful this year.</span></li>
</ul>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FROM THE CREW
</h3>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">New Year's resolutions are hard to keep in years where a global pandemic <em>hasn’t</em> shut down the world. So we’re guessing you might want a do-over halfway through 2020. Here's your opportunity: Write your halftime resolutions for the rest of the year today, and we’ll send you an email in December reminding you of what you wrote down. All you need to do is <a href="https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/Y56ppx2w?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fill this out</a>. </p>
</td>

WITH\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"clear\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/news/noted?mod=wsj_noted_MB_sectionfront_june20\" style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGood evening\u003c/strong\u003e (very weird to write)\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e \u003c/strong\u003eand welcome to a special edition Brew recapping the first half of 2020. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThink back to January 1. You were shaking hands with everyone you met. The words “social distancing” made absolutely no sense. And getting tested meant something...very different. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut humans adapt, and the fact that we’re still here reading email like chumps shows our resilience. We hope this newsletter allows you to take a step back, put all the events of H1 in context, and go into the second half of the year with more energy and purpose. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp class=\"p1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBefore we dive in...\u003c/strong\u003ewe want to offer a huge thank you to all the frontline and essential workers who made the world turn in H1, from doctors and nurses to store clerks and municipal workers. Your perseverance will not be forgotten.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END HEADER --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nECONOMY\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/28/reflecting-h1s-historic-economic-shutdown?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nThe Great Pause: We Can Do That?\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Coronavirus\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82NzIvY29yb25hdmlydXMucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhat will the first half of 2020 be remembered for? Likely when a microscopic parasite much, much smaller than bacteria—SARS-CoV-2—demanded that we slam the brakes on the global economy to prevent mass death. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSo we did. Countries around the globe performed the first coordinated global shutdown of the economy...ever. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRestaurants, retail stores, and offices were shuttered. Bustling airports turned into ghost towns. With theaters closed, performers were forced to give concerts on balconies. \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/WorldwideFP/status/1238850458011275264?s=20\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eSome\u003c/a\u003e were better than \u003ca href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VCyB15M6Jzw\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eothers\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNot to get all 1am in the dorm room on you, but it's worth pausing to consider just how un...paralleled that is. Starting with…\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe fallout\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYou already know this part. We're in the worst economic crisis since the Great Depression. 93% of the world's workforce lives in countries with partial or full workplace closures, the UN said in April. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn Q2, the world lost the equivalent of 400 million full-time jobs due to a decline in working hours from the COVID-19 crisis, the UN's labor arm \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.ilo.org/global/about-the-ilo/newsroom/news/WCMS_749398/lang--en/index.htm?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereported\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAs for the macro stats...\u003c/strong\u003elast week, the IMF projected the global economy will \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/24/business/imf-world-economic-outlook.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshrink\u003c/a\u003e by 4.9% this year, worse than earlier projections. It called this \"a crisis like no other.\"\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNTIxL2ltZi5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24ifQ==\" class=\"img-responsive\" width=\"640\" style=\"width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;\" alt=\"\" data-reactroot=\"\"\u003e\u003csup style=\"display: inline-block; line-height: 16px;\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eIMF\u003c/em\u003e \u003c/small\u003e\u003c/sup\u003e \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eHow we're getting through it \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eNo. 1: \u003c/strong\u003eA historic tsunami of government intervention.\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e \u003c/strong\u003eIn the U.S., Congress has \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2020/05/15/854774681/congress-has-approved-3-trillion-for-coronavirus-relief-so-far-heres-a-breakdown?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eauthorized\u003c/a\u003e a record-shattering $3 trillion for coronavirus relief—and it may not be done yet. The Fed, meanwhile, has done everything it can to encourage spending, borrowing, and investing short of secretly installing Robinhood apps on our phones like it's a U2 album. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eNo. 2: \u003c/strong\u003eAdvanced communications and information tech allowed many workplaces to shift to remote in surprisingly seamless fashion. Sophisticated delivery systems enabled by the smartphone brought the grocery store, local restaurants, and bookstores to our doorsteps. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eRetailers\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ealso \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/amazon-to-keep-most-of-the-jobs-it-added-during-pandemic-11590661802?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eadjusted\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e logistics systems to keep the drop-offs coming. Amazon added 125,000 permanent jobs during the pandemic, while Walmart hired more than 235,000 temporary workers.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe focus has shifted from the shutdown to the best way to un-shut-down. That's going to be \u003ca href=\"https://www.politico.com/news/magazine/2020/06/16/coronavirus-shutdown-kill-switch-320497?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emuch more\u003c/a\u003e complicated. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nCorporate America Joins the Fight\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Don't do it ad\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMTc3L2Rvbl90X2RvX2l0X2FkLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eNike\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis spring, killings of three unarmed Black Americans led to the most widespread protests over racial injustice and police brutality in decades. And this time, a new face joined the action: corporate America.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBusinesses said the three words they’ve skirted for years: Black Lives Matter. And they promised, \u003cem\u003ethis time\u003c/em\u003e, things would change.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSome broke open their wallets.\u003c/strong\u003e Bank of America \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-minneapolis-police-bank-of-america/bank-of-america-pledges-1-billion-to-address-racial-economic-inequality-idUSKBN2391NO?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epledged\u003c/a\u003e $1 billion over four years to address inequality. PayPal set up a $530 million fund to support minority-owned businesses. Pepsi’s $400+ million initiative includes doubling its spend with Black-owned suppliers. And Walmart, Comcast, Sony, Apple, Netflix, and SoftBank committed $100 million apiece to various initiatives. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOthers looked twice at what they’re selling. \u003c/strong\u003eQuaker Oats and Mars are \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/17/aunt-jemima-uncle-bens-owners-rethink-offensive-brands?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eremoving\u003c/a\u003e racist branding and imagery from Aunt Jemima and Uncle Ben’s food lines, respectively. Beauty giants Unilever and L’Oréal will remove “fair” and “whitening” labels from skin lightening products. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn tech, Amazon and Microsoft said they'd \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2020/06/12/microsoft-amazon-announce-restrictions-facial-recognition-sales-police-departments.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epause\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e selling facial recognition software, which has been criticized for showing racial bias, to police departments. IBM shut down its facial recognition unit completely.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn retail, chains including Sephora and Rent the Runway signed the 15 Percent Pledge to devote more shelf space to products from Black-owned businesses. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethose are powerful commitments from some of the private sector’s most influential brands. style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nSOCIAL MEDIA\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nJack Dorsey Would Like a Vacation\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf you know a business that hasn't been profoundly transformed in H1, reply with the name because we didn't know there were companies on Mars. 2020 has presented crisis after crisis for corporate America, and we can't think of a better case study than Twitter.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eCOVID-19\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn an oddly prescient moment in February, CEO Jack Dorsey told investors Twitter would move to a \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/02/08/twitter-ceo-jack-dorsey-san-francisco-comments-a-warning-sign.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emore distributed workforce\u003c/a\u003e. After the pandemic reached the West Coast, it was among the first to let staff WFH; by March 11, WFH was mandatory. By May, it was a permanent option.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eDorsey also personally pledged $1 billion (~25% of his wealth) to COVID-19 relief and other causes, the biggest individual contribution by far.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eProtests\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs demonstrations against racial injustice spread, Twitter was one of, if not the, \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/10/opinion/sunday/twitter-protest-politics.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emost important\u003c/a\u003e platforms for protestors to share information and organize. And a few weeks ago, Twitter led big businesses in making Juneteenth a corporate holiday. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eMisinformation\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMay 26, 2020, may go down as one of the most important dates in Twitter history after a pair of Trump tweets about mail-in voting finally \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/05/30/technology/twitter-trump-dorsey.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eset off\u003c/a\u003e the tripwire: Twitter \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/700c52aab0869253625b80255a397f19?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elabeled\u003c/a\u003e them as \"potentially misleading,\" and a few days later labeled another Trump tweet as \"glorifying violence.\" \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHeading into the election, President Trump and all of social media are twisted up in their thorniest tussle over content moderation to date.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eIn February, activist investors reportedly tried to \u003ca href=\"https://www.usatoday.com/story/tech/2020/02/28/twitter-ceo-jack-dorsey-elliott-management/4910121002/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eoust\u003c/a\u003e Dorsey. Today, he's set aside the ice baths and meditation retreats to steer Twitter through a trio of crises. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe 2020 news cycle has been dominated by a pair of storylines, and—with Luke Hemsworth as proof—we don't always notice the third thing when two take up our attention. Here are some important biz stories that flew under the radar this year...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig tech: \u003c/strong\u003eThe FTC expanded its investigations into the largest tech companies over \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/tech-summer-antitrust-24cffcc6-8afc-41f8-9b91-5be6d8269202.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eanticompetition concerns\u003c/a\u003e. The Justice Department, House Judiciary Committee, and state attorneys general have all launched antitrust probes that will heat up this summer, virus or not.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSamsung scandal: \u003c/strong\u003eThe South Korean conglomerate is \u003ca href=\"https://www.economist.com/business/2020/06/20/no-end-in-sight-for-samsungs-legal-troubles?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estill wading through\u003c/a\u003e a swamp of legal troubles surrounding its founding family. De facto leader Lee Jae-yong is currently awaiting trial for manipulating merger terms, among other allegations. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGig workers: \u003c/strong\u003eFood delivery services were hit with lawsuits as DoorDash and others \u003ca href=\"https://www.foodandwine.com/news/san-francisco-district-attorney-sues-doordash?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003econtinued to classify\u003c/a\u003e workers as independent contractors rather than employees, defying California's new AB 5 law.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTrade: \u003c/strong\u003eAs the COVID-19 blame game soured relations between China and the U.S., suspicions arose that the countries' Phase 1 trade deal, signed in January, would collapse. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eWhite House trade advisor Peter Navarro \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/23/business/economy/trump-navarro-china-trade-deal.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewalked back\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e his recent statement that the deal was over, and President Trump said it remains \"fully intact.\" \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSpace travel:\u003c/strong\u003e We doubt you missed the news that a private company (SpaceX) flew humans into space for the first time in May. style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nThese Needed the Bump of a Pandemic\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt sometimes feels like the world stopped spinning in 2020. Well, most of the time. But the pandemic also took some trends that were just getting a foothold and shot them into overdrive.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRemote work: \u003c/strong\u003eWhen lockdowns started in March, businesses had only days to spin up the infrastructure to support a remote workforce. Now that offices are slowly reopening, a growing cohort of workers may never endure a daily commute again as employers \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/29/remote-work-destiny?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eembrace WFH\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHigher ed:\u003c/strong\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/15/higher-ed-will-never?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eColleges\u003c/a\u003e are built around cramming youths into dorms and stuffing their minds with knowledge in lecture halls. That model may not work for the upcoming academic year, and colleges are racing to prepare virtual-first learning experiences. Major changes in the admissions process are also underway as universities finally throw out standardized test requirements. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eVirtual spaces: \u003c/strong\u003ePeople are finding new ways to socialize, and gaming platforms provide, quite literally, \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/08/virtual-worlds-stay?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enew worlds\u003c/a\u003e for hanging out and entertainment. While the Staples Center can hold 20,000...\u003cem\u003eFortnite\u003c/em\u003e can hold a lot more. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCities:\u003c/strong\u003e Urban areas need to \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/24/future-cities?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erethink and redesign\u003c/a\u003e with public health in mind. Many were starting to dabble in smart city tech, and now they'll have extra ammunition to make big investments in sensors, automation, and other tech that can help improve safety and health.   \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRetail:\u003c/strong\u003e Online shopping was trending up before the pandemic, but now its prospects are looking brighter than ever—in the U.S., e-commerce sales \u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2020/05/12/us-e-commerce-sales-jump-49-in-april-led-by-online-grocery/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eincreased\u003c/a\u003e 49% in April. The hottest category is \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/19/covid-consumer?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eonline grocery shopping\u003c/a\u003e, which has made years' worth of inroads in a few months. March sales were 200% higher than last year.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse:
